definitions.definition: To change with time or a similar parameter.
definitions.example: He varies his magic tricks so as to minimize the possibility that any given audience member will see the same trick twice.

definitions.definition: To institute a change in, from a current state; to modify.
definitions.example: You should vary your diet. Eating just bread will do you harm in the end.

definitions.definition: Not to remain constant: to change with time or a similar parameter.
definitions.example: His mood varies by the hour.

definitions.definition: (of the members of a group) To display differences.
definitions.example: The sprouting tendency of potatoes varies between cultivars, years and places of growing.

definitions.definition: To be or act different from the usual.
To make of different kinds; to make different from one another; to diversity; to variegate.
To embellish; to change fancifully; to present under new aspects, as of form, key, measure, etc. See variation.
To disagree; to be at variance or in dissension.
